timeline.message:
Added UUID to Game

This will be used to uniquely identify a game, which in term will be used to
determine where to save the summary images to.

Added GUIPrefs for BV and Minimap summary imgs

These will be what determine whether the summary images should be saved.

Fixed bug with List type in CommonSettignsDialog

I had been trying to add elements to a List created with Arrays.asList, and
it didn't work out so well.

Fix issue with how userdata tilesets are added

Would cause NPEs if no tilesets were present in the userdata directory.
Configuration stores locs to game summary imgs
Added game summary img options to Client Settings
Generate new Game UUID when reset

Implement game summary images for minimap

When the phase is changed from deployment, movement, firing, targeting or
physical, the current minimap image is saved to a file.

Implement game summary images for board view

When the phase is changed from deployment, movement, firing, targeting or
physical, the current board image is saved to a file.

Added minimap game summary option

Looks like this got removed during the latest merge with master.

Add phase name to summary image filename

to make it easier for users to distinguish phases.  I left in the
ordinal so that files sort properly.  This should make it easier to
combine images into gifs or videos.

Update shadow map when creating board image

I noticed some inconsistencies with shadows.  This makes
IBoardView.getEntireBoardImage match IBoardView.paintComponents.

Set zoom to 1 before saving board image

This makes it consistent in terms of what gets saved, otherwise the
output image is dependent upon the current zoom level.

replies.bodyText: My code formatter was improperly configured and it was inserting some tabs.  I saw this during the commit and I should've fixed it then.  I've fixed it now (there were a few other places too besides this one).
replies.author: arlith

timeline.bodyText: Curious: when would uuid be null?
timeline.author: sixlettervariables

replies.bodyText:
It wouldn't be.  As the code is written now, it can't be (the constructor initializes it and there's no setter).  I'm pretty sure I wrote this just to be defensive.
Actually, I think I was thinking about saved games from previous versions, but those might just fail to deserialize.
It's easy enough to remove the condition if you want, but I also don't really think it harms anything.  Maybe it would be better to log a message at that point, since it's a condition we'd expect not to happen.
replies.author: arlith

replies.bodyText: I'm okay as is. We also don't guarantee save games across versions so no worries there.
replies.author: sixlettervariables
